meanings.definition: The conditional release of a prisoner before the end of their sentence.
meanings.sent1: After serving part of his sentence, the prisoner was granted paroles.
meanings.sent2: The judge decided to grant him paroles for good behavior.
meanings.sent3: The idea of paroles seemed like a fair compromise to the prisoner.
meanings.sent4: Paroles can be a second chance for those who have shown remorse.
meanings.sent5: The concept of paroles offers hope for rehabilitation.

meanings.definition: A promise or pledge given by a prisoner to abide by certain conditions in exchange for early release.
meanings.sent1: She made a solemn paroles to follow all the rules upon release.
meanings.sent2: His paroles included regular check-ins with the parole officer.
meanings.sent3: The prisoner's paroles was a commitment to turn his life around.
meanings.sent4: Making paroles is a serious commitment to change one's ways.
meanings.sent5: Her paroles was a vow to stay out of trouble.

meanings.definition: To release a prisoner on parole.
meanings.sent1: The warden decided to paroles the inmate due to good behavior.
meanings.sent2: They will paroles him early if he continues to show progress.
meanings.sent3: The prison staff will paroles the prisoner next week.
meanings.sent4: The judge will paroles the convict after the hearing.
meanings.sent5: The decision to paroles the offender was carefully considered.
